value.title: Document your Power BI Desktop models with DAX Studio!
value.excerpt: Extract a list of measures, tables, etc, from your Power BI model with DAX Studio.  Download the PPUtility add-in here: http://www.sqlbi.com/tools/power-pivot-utilities  Link to DAX STUDIO: https://daxstudio.codeplex.com/  Our Playlists: - - Join our DAX Fridays! value.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
value.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. In Power BI, sometimes, when we perform Union operation, the combined data have some inconsistent mechanism, meaning one column's data merged with another column. The main reason

value.title: All Selected DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to one another episode of Wednesday with DAX. During this session, we will talk about the most important DAX expression ALLSELECTED(). Most of the time we have confusion between when to use ALL and when to use ALLSELECTED DAX function. First, we have taken one real life example and scenario here.

value.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new series – “Wednesday with DAX”. This is the first video of this series. The first episode covers all Date and Time functions used in Power BI In this video, we will talk about Date and Time functions in Power BI. We will discuss about most useful date and time functions in Power BI.

value.title: Find and Remove Last Occurrence from a String using Power BI DAX
value.excerpt: During this session, we will learn how we can find and remove last occurrence from a string using Power BI DAX. This is equivalent to Text Before Delimitator property in Power Query. In Power Query we can get before specific occurrence from string very easily. But how we can achieve the same using Power

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI

DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/  SQL Server Management Studio: https://docs.microsoft.com/sql/ssms/download-sql-server-management-studio-ssms?view=sql-server-ver15

Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

However, sometimes, you just want this to be in DAX way, so here in this blog and video, I explained how to create

value.title: Creating Calendar Table in Power BI using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: I have previously explained about using Power Query for creating calendar tables, However, some people still love to do that in DAX. There are a couple of DAX functions which makes the process of creating a calendar table very simple and easy; Calendar() and CalendarAuto(). In this short video, I'll

value.title: DAX Measure in the Axis of the Power BI Report
value.excerpt: If you even need to show your DAX measures in a chart without a dimension to slice and dice it, you won’t get a great experience in the visual. In this video, I’ll share a trick that you can use to have a nice visualization like what you see in the above screenshot. Download the file and study more from
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CRs2CnW7tVU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Day of Year and Day of Quarter   DAX calculations for Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has some built-in, easy-to-use DAX functions to get the Day of Month and Day of the week, but nothing for Day of Year and Day of the quarter. These calculations, however, are very simple and easy to implement using other functions. This short blog and video explain a method to calculate those
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ulT8HtF4gT0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: FILTER Function in DAX and Power BI   Apply Custom Filter to Calculations
value.excerpt: You can apply filtering to visualization elements. However, sometimes filtering has to be done on specific calculations. This can come in handy especially when you want to compare values of other items with specific items. In this article and video, I’ll explain how to use the FILTER function in DAX
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jcOa4sEMDDs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. In this video, I'll explain some functions in DAX that you can use to do this calculation. Most of these functions can be used inside a measure
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pPJwIzPck1U" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I’ll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi
